abstract.para: This article describes how to configure a new virtual machine suitable for the &productnameshort; deployment by using the &vmm;.

listitem.para: Download either the &productnameshort; raw disk or &alp-installer; image from on the &vmhost; where you will run virtualized &productnameshort;.

important.title: Encrypted image does not expand to the full disk capacity
important.para: As of now, the encrypted raw disk image does not expand to the full disk capacity automatically. As a workaround, the following steps are required:

step.para: Use the qemu-img command to increase the disk image to the desired size.
When the system is ready, use the parted command to resize the partition where the LUKS device resides (for example, partition number 3) to the desired size.
Run the cryptsetup resize luks command. When asked, enter the passphrase to resize the encrypted device.
Run the transactional-update shell command to open a read-write shell in the current disk snapshot. Then resize the BTRFS file system to the desired size, for example:
Leave the shell with exit and reboot the system with reboot.

section.title: Configuring a virtual machine for &productnameshort; deployment

step.para: Start &vmm; and select FileNew Virtual Machine.
For deployment using the &alp-installer;, select Local install media.
For the raw disk deployment, select Import existing disk image.
Confirm with Forward.
Specify the path to the &productnameshort; disk image that you previously downloaded and the type of linux OS you are deploying, for example, Generic Linux 2020. Confirm with Forward.
Specify the amount of memory and number of processors that you want to assign to the &productnameshort; virtual machine and confirm with Forward.
For deployment using the &alp-installer;, enable storage for the virtual machine and specify the size of the disk image.
Specify the name for the virtual machine and the network to be used.
If you are deploying an encrypted &productnameshort; image, perform these additional steps:
Enable Customize configuration before install and confirm with Finish.
Click Overview from the left menu and change the boot method from BIOS to UEFI for secure boot. Confirm with Apply.

figure.title: Set UEFI firmware for the encrypted &productnameshort; image

textobject.phrase: Set UEFI firmware for the encrypted &productnameshort; image

step.para: Add a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) device. Click Add Hardware, select TPM from the left menu, and select the Emulated type.
Confirm with Finish and start the &productnameshort; deployment by clicking Begin Installation from the top menu.

For the raw disk image deployment, to deploy &productnameshort; with only minimal setup options, confirm with Finish. The disk image will be booted and &jeosfirstboot; will take care of the deployment. Refer to for next steps.
